tit.cmt: 「おおく」： Oku と訳しました。

sen.j: 置始大伯（おきそめのおおく）は、日本の飛鳥時代の人物である。
sen.e: OKISOME no Oku (置始大伯) is a Japanese who lived in Asuka period.
sen.cmt: 「おおく」： Oku と訳しました。
sen.e: OKISOME no Oku lived in the Asuka period of Japan.
OKISOME no Oku lived in the Asuka period of Japan.
The name is also written as 多久.
His name Oku (大伯) was also written as 多久 (the pronunciation was the same).

sen.j: 旧仮名遣いでの読みは「おきそめのおほく」。
sen.e: The reading in old Japanese syllabary characters is 'OKISOME no Ohoku.'
According to the old Japanese syllabary characters, it is considered that his name had been pronounced as 'Okisome no Ofoku.'
sen.cmt: 誤訳です。飛鳥時代、は行は「ｆ」音で発音されていたので「ofoku」となります。オリジナル著者がこの文章を入れたのは発音の違いを示すためです。「旧仮名遣いでの」という説明はこの著者以外使わないと思われますが、正しく訳すと左のようになります。
sen.e: According to the old Japanese syllabary characters, it is considered that his name had been pronounced as 'Okisome no Ofoku.'
His kabane is Muraji.
His kabane was Muraji.

sen.j: 654年に遣唐使の一員として唐に渡り、翌年帰国。
sen.e: In 654, he moved to Tang Dynasty China as a member of Japanese envoy
In 654, he went to Tang Dynasty China as a member of Kentoshi (Japanese envoy to Tang), and the next year he returned to Japan.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミス、訳漏れがあります。
sen.e: In 654, he went to Tang Dynasty China as a member of Kentoshi (Japanese envoy to Tang), and the next year he returned to Japan.

sen.j: 672年の壬申の乱では大海人皇子（天武天皇）の側についた。
sen.e: In the Jinshin War in 672, he supported Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu).

sen.j: 693年に窃盗の罪に問われたが、壬申の乱のときの功に免じて赦された。
sen.e: He was accused of theft in 693, but relieved for his service in the Jinshin War.
He was accused of theft in 693, however, he was pardoned out of consideration for his service in the Jinshin War.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。

sen.j: 白雉5年（654年）2月、置始大伯は、高向玄理を押使、河辺麻呂を大使とする遣唐使の一員となった。
sen.e: In February, 654, OKISOME no Oku became a member of a Japanese envoy to Tang Dynasty China for which oshi (the highest rank in an envoy) was TAKAMUKO no Kuromaro and taishi (commander-in-chief) was KAWABE no Maro.
sen.cmt: 「大伯」： Oku と訳しました。
sen.e: In February, 654, OKISOME no Oku became a member of Kentoshi with Oshi (leader of envoy) TAKAMUKO no Kuromaro and Taishi (assistant leader of envoy) KAWABE no Maro.

sen.j: このとき大伯の位は小乙上であった。
sen.e: At that time, Oku's rank was Shootsu (the seventeenth and eighteenth grades of nineteen grades of cap rank)
sen.cmt: 「大伯」： Oku と訳しました。
sen.e: At that time, Oku's rank was Shootsujo.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れがあります。この時代位階制度が頻繁に変わっていますので、位の細かい説明は不要と思われますが括弧を加えるならseventeenth-gradeです。
sen.e: At that time, Oku's rank was Shootsujo.

sen.j: この遣唐使は、斉明天皇元年（655年）8月に帰った。
sen.e: The Japanese envoy to Tang Dynasty China came back to Japan in August, 655.

sen.j: 『日本書紀』の壬申の乱のくだりに置始大伯の名は現れないが、次に述べる窃盗事件の詔で、大海人皇子側で活躍したことがわかる。
sen.e: Though the name of OKISOME no Oku isn't mentioned in the description of the Jinshin War in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), the proclamation of the theft mentioned below proves that he made great achievements supporting Prince Oama.

sen.j: 持統天皇7年（693年）4月22日、盗みの犯人として大伴男人、置始多久、菟野大伴を、見逃した罪で巨勢邑治を裁く詔が下された。
sen.e: On April 22, 693, a proclamation was issued to judge KOSE no 邑治 for letting OTOMO no Ohito, OKISOME no Oku, and TONO no Otomo go as thieves.
On April 22, 693, a proclamation was issued to judge the theft by OTOMO no Ohito, OKISOME no Oku, and UNO no Otomo, and to judge the connivance by KOSE no Oji.
sen.cmt: 誤訳です。このとき裁かれたのはこの四人全員です。「菟野」は「うの」、「邑治」は「おおじ」。
sen.e: On April 22, 693, a proclamation was issued to judge the theft by OTOMO no Ohito, OKISOME no Oku, and UNO no Otomo, and to judge the connivance by KOSE no Oji.

sen.j: 具体的内容は記されていないが、罪に問われた官人の役職から、官物横領と思われる。
sen.e: There is no concrete content described, however, considering the accused government official's post, it seems to have been embezzlement of kanmotsu (tribute goods paid as taxes or tithes).

sen.j: 置始多久はこのとき鍵を管理する典鑰であった。
sen.e: At that time, OKISOME no Oku was Tenyaku who managed keys.

sen.j: 位一階を下げ、官を解かれることになったが、壬申の年の功によって特別に赦され、贓物の返済だけでよいとされた。
sen.e: He was demoted by one rank and removed from the government, however, for the service in the year of Mizunoe-Saru (one of the Oriental Zodiac), he was given an amnesty and only had to return gifts.

He was demoted to one lower rank and removed from the Imperial Court, however, for the service in the year of Jinshin (the Jinshin War), he was given an amnesty with only one condition that he had to return those stolen things.
